@ digico and anyone else who needs help with an unsynced video/subtitle file: VLC has an option in subtitle settings for "delay," in tenths of a second. this can either be a positive or negative value. it only takes a minute or two to figure out the difference between the timestamp of the first line of text in an .srt file and the timestamp of the first voice needing subtitles in the corresponding movie. once you've figured that out, convert it to tenths of a second and use it as your delay, either + or -.
